Crime_Name: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act Violation
Legal_Issue: Whether the RPD's decision to refuse reinstating the applicant's refugee claim was reasonable
Application_Facts: Applicant withdrew her refugee claim impulsively but later sought reinstatement due to fear of returning to Colombia
Decision_Outcome: RPD refused to reinstate the refugee claim
Court_Ruling: Federal Court dismissed the application for judicial review
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review under subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Used: Evidence related to withdrawal and delay in reinstatement request
Legal_Provision_Cited: Rule 53 of the Refugee Protection Division Rules
Application_Basis: Breach of natural justice or interests of justice
Evidence_Assessed: Lack of evidence supporting need for reinstatement
Governing_Rule: Rule 53 of the Refugee Protection Division Rules
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of evidence provided by applicant
Outcome: Application for judicial review dismissed; no reinstatement
Harm_Assessment: Fear of harm upon return to Colombia
Cause_Description: Applicant withdrew her refugee claim impulsively and later sought reinstatement due to fear of returning to Colombia
Evidence_Handling: RPD assessed delay and lack of evidence as factors against reinstatement
Legal_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, subsection 72(1)
Evidence_Assessment: Delay and lack of evidence weighed against applicant
Decision_Rationale: No breach of natural justice; not in the interests of justice due to delay and lack of evidence
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of supporting evidence for reinstatement
